ticket.title: Wrong view rendered
ticket.original-body:
In one of the /views folders of my application, among the .html.erb files there are:
* show.html.erb * show.html.erbok (an old version of show.html.erb, rename with "erbok" extension)
When I run the "show" action in the controller, instead of rendering show.html.erb, show.html.erbok is rendered.
The show action is
def show @ust = User.find(params[:id]) end
I am using Rails 2.2.2 on Mac OSX 10.5.
ticket.latest-body:
In one of the /views folders of my application, among the .html.erb files there are:
* show.html.erb * show.html.erbok (an old version of show.html.erb, rename with "erbok" extension)
When I run the "show" action in the controller, instead of rendering show.html.erb, show.html.erbok is rendered.
The show action is
def show @ust = User.find(params[:id]) end
I am using Rails 2.2.2 on Mac OSX 10.5.
ticket.original-body-html:
In one of the /views folders of my application, among the .html.erb files there are:

  • show.html.erb
  • show.html.erbok (an old version of show.html.erb, rename with "erbok" extension)

When I run the "show" action in the controller, instead of rendering show.html.erb, show.html.erbok is rendered.

The show action is

def show @ust = User.find(params[:id]) end

I am using Rails 2.2.2 on Mac OSX 10.5.

version.body:
In one of the /views folders of my application, among the .html.erb files there are:
* show.html.erb * show.html.erbok (an old version of show.html.erb, rename with "erbok" extension)
When I run the "show" action in the controller, instead of rendering show.html.erb, show.html.erbok is rendered.
The show action is
def show @ust = User.find(params[:id]) end
If I delete show.html.erbok, all works fine and show.html.erb is rendered.
I am using Rails 2.2.2 on Mac OSX 10.5.
version.body-html:
In one of the /views folders of my application, among the .html.erb files there are:

  • show.html.erb
  • show.html.erbok (an old version of show.html.erb, rename with "erbok" extension)

When I run the "show" action in the controller, instead of rendering show.html.erb, show.html.erbok is rendered.

The show action is

def show @ust = User.find(params[:id]) end

If I delete show.html.erbok, all works fine and show.html.erb is rendered.

I am using Rails 2.2.2 on Mac OSX 10.5.
version.title: Wrong view rendered

version.body: Confirmed with rails 2.2.2 and 2.3.0 on Ubuntu 8.10. I had _form.html.haml and _form.html.haml~ (old backup) in one of my views folders and I was wondering why my updates are not rendered even after restarting server. After deleting backup copy everything works fine.
version.body-html: Confirmed with rails 2.2.2 and 2.3.0 on Ubuntu 8.10. I had form.html.haml and form.html.haml~ (old backup) in one of my views folders and I was wondering why my updates are not rendered even after restarting server. After deleting backup copy everything works fine.
version.title: Wrong view rendered

version.body: The problem is that unknown extension types fallback to erb rendering. I know a patch was submitted for this, but maybe they only really wanted ones with no extension to fallback to erb.
version.body-html: The problem is that unknown extension types fallback to erb rendering. I know a patch was submitted for this, but maybe they only really wanted ones with no extension to fallback to erb.
version.title: Wrong view rendered

version.body: (from [e4a7c0bb5b175e6eceb2fe808075d6122521237c]) ~ backup files don't clobber original templates [#1818 state:resolved] http://github.com/rails/rails/commit/e4a7c0bb5b175e6eceb2fe808075d6122521237c
version.body-html: (from [e4a7c0bb5b175e6eceb2fe808075d6122521237c]) ~ backup files don't clobber original templates [#1818 state:resolved] http://github.com/rails/rails/co...
version.title: Wrong view rendered

version.body:
Looks like that commit may not have fixed the problem.
See the attached patch, it just adds a "shared.html.erb~" file to actionpack's test fixtures, which causes existing tests to fail.
Apologies for not doing something more positive, like writing a patch that works. I did try, but couldn't get my head around the template-finding code.
version.body-html:
Looks like that commit may not have fixed the problem.

See the attached patch, it just adds a "shared.html.erb~" file to actionpack's test fixtures, which causes existing tests to fail.

Apologies for not doing something more positive, like writing a patch that works. I did try, but couldn't get my head around the template-finding code.
version.title: Wrong view rendered

version.body:
Sorry, but I don't think this is going to be fix fixable for 2.3.
In 3.0 we can revisit this try to come up with a solid template choosing solution.
version.body-html:
Sorry, but I don't think this is going to be fix fixable for 2.3.

In 3.0 we can revisit this try to come up with a solid template choosing solution.
version.title: Wrong view rendered

version.body: I've just added ticket #1909 which should fix this problem along with some extra benefits. I'd be grateful if you could check it out and see if it fixes things for you.
version.body-html: I've just added ticket #1909 which should fix this problem along with some extra benefits. I'd be grateful if you could check it out and see if it fixes things for you.
version.title: Wrong view rendered

version.body:
I've just run into this problem with the released version 2.3.2.
With these files present:
app/views/controller/view.html.erb app/views/controller/view.html.erb.~1~
the latter (emacs backup file) is being picked up instead of being ignored like in rails 2.1.x and earlier versions. I have not tested with rails 2.2.x.
Reading through #1909 it seems that the fix Andrew mentions in his comment should already be applied to 2.3.2, but this problem still persists.
version.body-html:
I've just run into this problem with the released version 2.3.2.

With these files present:

app/views/controller/view.html.erb app/views/controller/view.html.erb.~1~

the latter (emacs backup file) is being picked up instead of being ignored like in rails 2.1.x and earlier versions. I have not tested with rails 2.2.x.

Reading through #1909 it seems that the fix Andrew mentions in his comment should already be applied to 2.3.2, but this problem still persists.
version.title: Wrong view rendered

version.body:
Hi Hans,
what about master (past v2.3.2.1 tag)?
